column2: called the "Forest between Rivers" since it lay between the rivers Sirion and Gelion
column3: was the dark and gloomy forest that extended over a vast area of land to the south of the Andram. None but a few Dark Elves ever wandered there.

column1: The name Taur-im-Duinath literally means "forest between rivers" in Sindarin
column2: consisting of taur ("forest") + im ("between") + duin ("river") + -ath (collective plural suffix).
column3: p. 38http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth at http://www.tolkiendil.com Tolkiendil.com (accessed 14 December 2011)

column1: In the revised version of the second Silmarillion map appears the names Taur i Melegyrn ("Forest of the Great Trees") and Taur na Chardh√Æn ("Forest of the Southern Silence") for this region
column3: p. 185 although it is unknown if they were intended as replacements or alternative names.
